business.headline: Isha Ambani: Young visionary behind Reliance Retail's rapid expansionIsha Ambani's work has been key in driving the rapid growth of Reliance Retail, which is now India's largest retailer by revenue.

Mahatma Gandhi wasn't 1st choice for India's currency. Here's what happenedThe currency notes from the 1950s and 60s featured images of animals like tigers and deer, along with symbols of India's development, such as the Hirakud Dam, the Aryabhatta satellite, and the Brihadeeswara Temple.

RVNL shares down 19% from record high. Good time to buy? RVNL shares have corrected nearly 19% from its record high of Rs 647. Is now a good time to invest in RVNL stock, or should investors wait for clearer signals? Read on to know more.

New life insurance rules from today: What it means for you? As of October 1, policyholders will now be eligible for a guaranteed surrender value from the first year, even if they have only paid one annual premium. However, these new regulations are expected to lower returns for policyholders over time.

Google pays $2.7 billion to bring back AI visionary Noam ShazeerNoam Shazeer, 48, was one of Google's early hires, joining the company in 2000. A talented software engineer, Shazeer made his mark in AI, becoming a key figure in Google's early AI development.

India's factory growth cools to eight-month low in SeptemberNew orders - a key gauge of demand - grew at the weakest pace since December, though were still robust, while output was at an eight-month low.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: World Exclusive: India Today at bombed Hezbollah HQ where Nasrallah was killed India Today's Ashraf Wani reported live from Hezbollah headquarters in Lebanon's Beirut, becoming the first Indian journalist to get access there.

India calls for restraint, civilian protection amid escalating Mideast tensionsUrging all sides in the Middle East to maintain restraint, India said the conflict must not take a wider regional dimension and "dialogue and diplomacy" should be channelised to resolve all conflicting issues.

Over 500 kg of cocaine worth Rs 2,000 crore seized in Delhi's biggest drug bustFour people were arrested in connection with what is said to be the biggest drug bust in Delhi where over 500 kg of cocaine worth more than Rs 2,000 crore was seized during a raid.

Israel-Iran war: Is it the beginning of World War 3?West Asia is in turmoil as nearly 200 missiles were fired by Iran into Israel. The visuals of the ballistic missile tearing through the night sky, clubbed with the Ukraine-Russia war entering its third year, have sparked fears of World War 3. As tensions in the Middle East escalate, global concerns grow with World War 3 warnings from Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and widespread discussions on social media regarding the same.

Watch: Siddaramaiah gets help from man holding Tricolour to untie shoelacesA man, with a tricolour in his hands, was seen helping Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah untying his shoelaces when he went to garland a statue of Mahatma Gandhi on his birth anniversary. In the video, the man can be seen helping the senior Congress leader as he was standing before going to the garland of Mahatma Gandhi's statue. Later, a security personnel was seen taking the tricolour away from the man. Mahatma Gandhi, hailed as the father of the nation, steadfastly followed the principles of truth and non-violence, inspiring generations of politicians and activists around the world.

Shatrughan Sinha rules out 'ifs and buts' after Govinda's bullet injuryActor-politician Shatrughan Sinha confirmed Govinda's stable condition after an accidental self-inflicted gunshot injury. Sinha ruled out conspiracy theories around the gunshot injury.

Neeraj Chopra set to part ways with coach Klaus BartonietzStar Indian javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra and his coach Klaus Bartonietz are ending their five-year partnership. Bartonietz, citing age and family commitments, has decided to part ways with Chopra.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
